name: Nanemachi Waterfall
location: Gugulshi Village, Mahad Taluka, Raigad District, Maharashtra
description: Nanemachi Waterfall is a spectacular 400+ ft jungle waterfall located deep in the dense forests near Gugulshi village, Mahad. Renowned for its turquoise blue pool that glows in different hues throughout the day, it's a monsoon trekker’s paradise and considered one of Maharashtra's most beautiful hidden falls. Best enjoyed from June to September.

startingPoint.name: Gugulshi Village
facilities: Simple village toilets at base only
Guides and permit desk during monsoon weekends
startingPoint.description: Start your trek from Gugulshi. The route is a marked jungle trail, accessible for organized group batches and guided walks only during monsoon season. There is no assigned parking lot; locals manage parking on village farmlands and may charge a basic fee.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: 108 / 112 if signal is available in Gugulshi village.

restaurants: Local tea & poha stalls at Gugulshi (seasonal)
Homestyle lunch by village families (pre-booked or via trek operator)
shops: Small local provision shop (limited snacks, packaged water)

waterSources: No potable water on trail or at waterfall—carry at least 2 liters per person
foodOptions: No food stalls; bring packed food/snacks

facilities: No food or water facilities—leave no trash; carry back all waste

camping.reason: No overnight camping permitted at or near waterfall; forest department regulation

nearbyStays.name: Local Homestays (Gugulshi/Mahad)
facilities: Simple village rooms or dorm beds

permits.notes: Forest entry/eco permit compulsory (charged at base, includes local guide). No access after 3 PM.
permits.fee: ₹100–250 per person depending on season/weekends; included in trek packages.
permits.timings: Trekking allowed 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM only. Entry after 3:00 PM not permitted.

commonRisks: Slippery rocks near waterfall and stream crossings
High water and flash floods during heavy monsoon spells
No lifeguards—strictly no swimming in pool in high flow
precautions: Trek only with a registered guide
Wear rain gear and trekking shoes with good grip
Do not wander off marked trail
Keep group together and follow guide’s safety brief

byTrain.description: Konkan Railway to Veer/Sape Wamane Station, then taxi/auto to Gugulshi
steps: Train to Veer or Sape Wamane
Auto/rickshaw or pre-booked cab to Gugulshi village (25–30 km)

byBus.description: ST bus to Mahad from Mumbai, then taxi/auto to Gugulshi

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via Mumbai-Goa Highway (NH66) to Mahad, then local road to Gugulshi
steps: Follow signage or GPS to Gugulshi

byTrain.description: Train to Veer or Mangaon (Konkan route), then taxi/auto

byBus.description: ST bus to Mahad, then taxi/auto to Gugulshi

bestTimeToVisit: June to September (peak monsoon, waterfall at fullest; forest greenest)

localContacts.name: Trek/Permit Booking Desk (WhatsApp)
localContacts.service: Trek guide booking, permit info, group slots
